pain_points_original.title: Mandatory Government Security Compliance
pain_points_original.description: The solution must meet stringent, non-negotiable security standards, including IRAP certification at PROTECTED level and Australian data sovereignty. This is critical to protect sensitive government legal information, and failure to comply represents a significant and unacceptable security risk.

pain_points_original.title: Need for Explainable and Ethical AI
pain_points_original.description: AGS requires that any AI use is transparent, responsible, and explainable. This is crucial for maintaining legal integrity, as lawyers must be able to understand and defend the reasoning behind AI-generated outputs in high-stakes government legal matters, mitigating 'black box' AI risks.

pain_points_original.title: Seamless Integration with Core Legal Systems
pain_points_original.description: The AI tool must integrate with AGS's core software ecosystem (iManage, Elite 3E, Microsoft Office) which they are not replacing. A standalone tool would create data silos and disrupt workflows for over 570 lawyers, directly contradicting the primary goal of improving productivity.

pain_points_original.title: Low Productivity in Document-Intensive Work
pain_points_original.description: Lawyers spend excessive time on manual, document-heavy tasks like summarising, drafting from multiple sources, and large-scale discovery review. This inefficiency is a core challenge for a large legal provider like AGS, impacting service delivery speed and overall capacity.

pain_points_original.title: Risk of Missing Inconsistencies in Evidence
pain_points_original.description: Manually identifying contradictions and gaps across vast amounts of evidence (pleadings, witness statements) is difficult and high-risk. Missing key inconsistencies can fundamentally weaken a legal case, posing a significant threat to achieving favorable outcomes for government clients.

pain_points_original.title: Lack of Specialised Australian Legal AI Tools
pain_points_original.description: Generic AI tools often fail to grasp the nuances of Australian legislation and legal practice. AGS needs a solution specifically designed for the Australian context to ensure outputs are accurate and relevant, avoiding costly rework and maintaining the quality of legal advice for government.

pain_points_original.title: Need to Leverage Emerging Agentic AI
pain_points_original.description: AGS is concerned with falling behind technologically and seeks to understand how emerging agentic AI can automate complex, multi-step tasks. They want to move beyond basic generative AI to adopt systems that can handle goal-driven workflows, signaling a strategic push for innovation.

pain_points_original.title: Ensuring Compliance with Government Policies
pain_points_original.description: A significant challenge is manually validating documents against complex legislative instruments and government policies. This process is error-prone, and failure to ensure compliance creates serious legal and reputational risks for AGS and its government clients.

pain_points_original.title: System Scalability for National User Base
pain_points_original.description: The chosen solution must be able to support up to 1,000 concurrent internal users across AGS's national operations. A lack of scalability would result in poor performance, user frustration, and would ultimately prevent the successful adoption and realisation of productivity benefits.
